p: The TO2 and TO3 rabbits showed the lowest values whereas the highest value was recorded for TO1. The TBARS values also differed among rations fed to the rabbits ( P < 0.001). The lowest TBARS values were found in the POS and TO1 groups, intermediate values were observed for CON and TO2, and TO3 rabbits had the highest values. The OMb content in rabbit meat increased and MetMb decreased ( P < 0.001) with dietary thyme oil supplementation compared to CON group in fore, mid, and hind carcass. The OMb was higher in TO2 group for both fore and hind parts of carcass, while TO3 group had increased (quadratic, P < 0.001) OMb content for mid part of carcass when compared with their counterparts.
